job_title: Accounts Receivable Specialist in Akron, OH
pros: Great hours and friendly faces
cons: Low pay across the board

review_title: Mistreats employees and then makes excuses to cover themselves
pros: You work with some great people, and get to help addicts and inmates get their feet on the ground and better their lives when they accept the help and are ready for change.
cons: I was a pregnant employee who had my maternity scheduled, with paperwork and documents completed and ready to go. They took that away from me and furloughed me instead because in the words of my direct supervisor "you're going to be gone already" despite two other caseworkers volunteering to be furloughed in my place. They are unprofessional and this was despicable. I was furloughed, then had my child. Once I was approved for work by my doctor, I was re-furloughed with "high hopes" in their words that I would be back. In the mean time, as instructed after my hospital time ran out, I filed and collected unemployment. A year later and I am getting screwed saying I was overpaid because "I was unable to work." Which is false. The second they "offered" me a full time RS POSITION IN CLEVELAND, (I was a caseworker in Akron with a three year old and newborn in a pandemic) I resigned and stopped collecting. Thank you Oriana House for the year of hardship and stress.

pros: Good if you need experience.
cons: Poor training, very poor management.

pros: Nice people to work with but need to pay more
cons: Pay more money to its employee

pros: Moderate health benefits; good amount of vacation time

pros: Great training, great people, fulfilling work
cons: Very stressful environment at times, strange interoffice politics, HR is a nightmare. Promise raises but don't deliver.

pros: The staff was great to work with.
cons: Long shifts, they switched from 8 hours to 12 hours.

pros: Legacy: When I look back over my life I will have the honor of having served those less fortunate fellow members of our society and thereby assisted our society as a whole become safer. A little patience, some understanding and the Golden Rule enables many lost souls to find their moorings and become contributing members of the community in the positive. The training program at the Academy is an intense week of paid preparation that positions new-hires to get solid footing in how agency protocols work and why they are designed in that way. Ongoing training programs on a monthly basis keep employees abreast of cutting edge developments in the field while reinforcing already learned procedures, all paid for by the company. They were flexible enough to find room for an over 60 worker like myself willing to learn new concepts/skills and share of my own life's lessons.
cons: For me personally it was a bit daunting having to commute 40-45 mins. one-way but the drive time gave me the opportunity to amp-up and decompress with some inspirational music to and from the work site.

pros: -experience with criminal justice system
cons:
-lack of structure
-poor management
-a lot of extra work and training

job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Cleveland, OH
pros: 2 weeks vacation and personal/sick time earned yearly, earned hospital time for emergencies,  wonderful health insurance benefits.
cons: Lack of concern when reporting poor leadership.  If the supervisor likes the person you are reporting, absolutely nothing is done about the way they treat workers that are supervised.  The only recourse is to apply to another department or resign.

review_title: Review of a Counseling position at Oriana House
job_title: Chemical Dependency Treatment Counselor in Akron, OH
pros: Good experience gaining knowledge of the 12 core functions in addictions, documentation, internal training to gain and improve counseling skills working with difficult adults who have been adjudicated in various stages of change.
cons: There is a lot of documentation that is needed that exceeds 40% of a work week with  unrealistic deadline dates in many instances. As a result of  the amount of record keeping and the deadline dates it is extremely challenging to meet the needs of the clients sufficiently and the agency's requirements without burnout.

review_title: be aware and decide if you can tolerate cold management style
pros:
-- excellent training opportunities
-- once foot in the door, good chance to progress/switch jobs
-- lots of wonderful colleagues
-- strive to follow researched methods of reducing the clients return to criminal behavior
cons:
--Be careful if you want to help people; the company has a cookie cutter approach with clients that can make it tough to make a difference
--Company is extremely hierarchical-- lots of bosses and tight rules; quick to "write-up" and sanction staff that don't conform
--terrible pay when starting out at the front lines; supervisors paid much better

review_title: A great place to build experience
pros: Excellent training opportunities, great cohesion/ team mentality between co-workers at Glenwood Campus, considerate supervisors, relatively easy mobility/accommodation to work across programs and in multiple locations.  Treatment curriculum is relatively regimented and relatively easy to master, regularly scheduled clinician trainings keep group facilitation and documentation skills fresh and allow clinicians to continually develop them.
cons: poor physical facilities, highest frequency of hours of direct client services take place after 5 PM, low pay and high employee turnover, generally hostile clientele, need for clinicians and coverage of programs/day to day activities sometimes boarders on desperate.  Treatment curriculum and the theoretical basis of the service is very "hit or miss" with clients and not very individualized, curriculum has limited flexibility with various types of clients on the basis of culture, education level, and individual situation and thus an overall positive response is only visible sporadically, across clients.

job_title: Chemical Dependency Treatment Counselor in South Akron, OH
pros: Excellent training and hands on practical experience in the AoD field. Co-workers are very supportive.
cons: Overworked, high caseload with too much documentation and not enough time. Self-care is not emphasized and definitely overlooked. Management needs to revisit the workload and self-care and the way the staff is talked to.

review_title: Unless You're Perfect don't work here
pros: Parking is right next to the main office.
cons:
Unless you are perfect, an expert at being a sycophant, or unless you're great at constantly being cheerful or blonde. 

Don't work here. 

The staff is very unprofessional and I've never worked in a place where people were allowed to gossip and downgrade one another constantly in passive aggressive ways.

pros: Opportunities for great training and growth, good supervision, great motivated team that is willing to help you at any time. The work environment is rigorous but the experience is great. Great compensation too. Tuition reimbursement, benefits, paid time off and sick time.
cons: Short staffed (overtime/coverage needs), no paid maternity leave, politics within the treatment department/with other departments when collaborating.

review_title: My experience at Oriana House has been interesting and rewarding.
pros: Good benefits, no micro-managing and happy work environment.
cons: Pay rates need improvement, no security for the staff, not enough resources for the clients to help them improve, too much in-service training.

pros: Unlimited amount of overtime always available
cons: Administration had tendencies to promote people who did not deserve promotion. Treated clients unfairly. Staff constantly argued with clients. Most staff were scared to do their job most nights but insisted on antagonizing clients till they went off. Overall a bad experience with this particular building (1829 East 55th) cctc

Fantastic benefits

Rewarding Work

cons: I won't get rich here, but I make a decent living.
